summary: This bill, the Enhancing Transparency from Airlines Act of 2025 (ETA Act of 2025), mandates the Secretary of Transportation to issue regulations regarding delayed flight compensation for airline passengers. It codifies existing rules on refunds and ancillary fees, and requires airlines to compensate passengers for significant delays, with amounts ranging from $200 to $500 depending on the length of delay (3+ hours domestic, 6+ hours international).
